channel.title: Client not able to compile. (Noob Starter)
channel.description:
Hi there! I've programmed a couple of rsps before on my own and it went pretty okay. But this time it is different. I never really had to run into issue like this and this may be the easiest part of the compile, but what do i do from here?
Myproblem:
For some reason I'm not able to compile on client side.
it just kept saying
Note: client.java uses or override depreciated API Note: Recompile with -Xlint:deprecation for detail....
------------------------------------------------------------
1) within the help section it gives me the definition etc.
DeathsChaos9 thread: https://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php/topic,438121.0.html#post_notes
Note: ... Code: [Select] Note: Some input files use or override a deprecated API. Note: Recompile with -deprecation for details.
This is just a warning, not an error. In this example you could add -deprecation to your compiler to show where deprecated APIs are used.
Code: [Select] Javac -deprecation *.java Here is a list of Javac options: -g Generate all debugging info -g:none Generate no debugging info -g:{lines,vars,source} Generate only some debugging info -nowarn Generate no warnings -verbose Output messages about what the compiler is doing -deprecation Output source locations where deprecated APIs are used -classpath <path> Specify where to find user class files and annotation processors -cp <path> Specify where to find user class files and annotation processors -sourcepath <path> Specify where to find input source files -bootclasspath <path> Override location of bootstrap class files -extdirs <dirs> Override location of installed extensions -endorseddirs <dirs> Override location of endorsed standards path -proc:{none,only} Control whether annotation processing and/or compilation is done. -processor <class1>[,<class2>,<class3>...]Names of the annotation processors to run; bypasses default discovery process -processorpath <path> Specify where to find annotation processors -d <directory> Specify where to place generated class files -s <directory> Specify where to place generated source files -implicit:{none,class} Specify whether or not to generate class files for implicitly referenced files -encoding <encoding> Specify character encoding used by source files -source <release> Provide source compatibility with specified release -target <release> Generate class files for specific VM version -version Version information -help Print a synopsis of standard options -Akey[=value] Options to pass to annotation processors -X Print a synopsis of nonstandard options -J<flag> Pass <flag> directly to the runtime system
2) Again What do i do???
this is within my compiler...
@echo off Title Compiler "C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.8.0_05\bin\javac.exe" *.java pause
P.S. is there need to be something before *.java to determine where to identify where it is at? Any help on that as well? As in where?
I'm using Enrisep Source and Client.

item.title: Client not able to compile. (Noob Starter)
item.dc:creator: @geowayne geowayne
item.description:
@geowayne wrote:

Thank You my friend!

Read full topic
item.source: Client not able to compile. (Noob Starter)

item.title: Client not able to compile. (Noob Starter)
item.dc:creator: @IfearI IfearI
item.description:
@IfearI wrote:

As DeathsChaos9 states, it’s just a warning. Just ignore it, it’s not a big deal.

If you really want to know…

“client.java uses or override depreciated API” - means, as far as I know, in client.java is using code or overriding code which is deprecated.
Basically…lets say someone creates code which people then use. Then create something much better. Instead of deleting the old code, which breaks every program using it, the old code gets tagged deprecated to let people know not to use it. Deprecated-list, every class should have it stated in the java-documentation as well, if it is deprecated. Also, (some/most) IDE’s tend to point it out to you too when you try using a deprecated class/method.

Edit: I found you this and this as well, in case you didn’t understand me.

Read full topic
item.source: Client not able to compile. (Noob Starter)

item.title: Client not able to compile. (Noob Starter)
item.dc:creator: @geowayne geowayne
item.description:
@geowayne wrote:

Hi there! I’ve programmed a couple of rsps before on my own and it went pretty okay.
But this time it is different. I never really had to run into issue like this and this may be the easiest part of the compile,
but what do i do from here?

Myproblem:

For some reason I’m not able to compile on client side.

it just kept saying

Note: client.java uses or override depreciated API
Note: Recompile with -Xlint:deprecation for detail…

  1. within the help section it gives me the definition etc.

DeathsChaos9 thread: https://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php/topic,438121.0.html#post_notes

Note: …
Code: [Select]
Note: Some input files use or override a deprecated API.
Note: Recompile with -deprecation for details.

This is just a warning, not an error. In this example you could add -deprecation to your compiler to show where deprecated APIs are used.

Code: [Select]
Javac -deprecation *.java
Here is a list of Javac options:
-g Generate all debugging info
-g:none Generate no debugging info
-g:{lines,vars,source} Generate only some debugging info
-nowarn Generate no warnings
-verbose Output messages about what the compiler is doing
-deprecation Output source locations where deprecated APIs are used
-classpath Specify where to find user class files and annotation processors
-cp Specify where to find user class files and annotation processors
-sourcepath Specify where to find input source files
-bootclasspath Override location of bootstrap class files
-extdirs Override location of installed extensions
-endorseddirs Override location of endorsed standards path
-proc:{none,only} Control whether annotation processing and/or compilation is done.
-processor [,,…]Names of the annotation processors to run; bypasses default discovery process
-processorpath Specify where to find annotation processors
-d Specify where to place generated class files
-s Specify where to place generated source files
-implicit:{none,class} Specify whether or not to generate class files for implicitly referenced files
-encoding Specify character encoding used by source files
-source Provide source compatibility with specified release
-target Generate class files for specific VM version
-version Version information
-help Print a synopsis of standard options
-Akey[=value] Options to pass to annotation processors
-X Print a synopsis of nonstandard options
-J Pass directly to the runtime system

  1. Again What do i do???

this is within my compiler…

@echo off
Title Compiler
"C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.8.0_05\bin\javac.exe" *.java
pause

P.S. is there need to be something before *.java to determine where to identify where it is at? Any help on that as well? As in where?

I’m using Enrisep Source and Client.

Read full topic
